title: Centralized Zgent Logging
description:
## Overview
Implement convention-based centralized logging for multi-Zgent ecosystem. All Zgents write to a shared directory structure with first-class Zgent identity, enabling gtOps to aggregate and view logs across the system.

## Key Deliverables
1. **ZgentLogEntry schema** - First-class zgentId, sessionId fields
2. **ZgentTransport** - Writes to ~/.zgents/logs/{zgentId}/ convention
3. **Registry support** - ~/.zgents/registry.json for Zgent discovery
4. **createZgentLogger factory** - One-liner logger setup for any Zgent
5. **On-demand aggregation** - No daemon, view logs via CLI when needed

## Directory Convention
```
~/.zgents/
â”œâ”€â”€ registry.json          # Zgent manifest
â””â”€â”€ logs/
    â”œâ”€â”€ dreader/
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ 2026-02-07T10-00-00.jsonl
    â”œâ”€â”€ explorer/
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ 2026-02-07T10-05-00.jsonl
    â””â”€â”€ parseclipmate/
        â””â”€â”€ 2026-02-07T09-30-00.jsonl
```

## Design Principles
- Zero overhead when not viewing logs
- Each Zgent just writes to its own file
- Convention over configuration
- Real-time viewing via file watch (not daemon)

title: GitHub community archive for steveyegge/gastown
description:
Create local archive of GitHub Issues, PRs, and Discussions with significance scoring.

**Status:** Script functional, needs full sync
- âœ… gh-archive.sh script created with sample/full/sync/stats/top/recent commands  
- âœ… Discussions support via GraphQL API
- âœ… Significance scoring (comment count, reactions, body length, author, labels)
- â³ Full sync not yet run (waiting for review)
- âŒ /gh-community slash command not created

**Test:** `/root/gtOps/scripts/gh-archive.sh sample 10`
**Full sync:** `/root/gtOps/scripts/gh-archive.sh full` (runs ~2-3 min)

**Next steps:**
1. Review sample output, adjust scoring weights if needed
2. Run full sync
3. Create /gh-community slash command
4. Add to daily COO routine
close_reason: Archive system operational: 245 issues, 571 PRs, 24 discussions synced with significance scoring

title: tmux Enhancements
description: Ongoing category capturing refinements our app brings to tmux integration. Includes session management, pane layouts, keybindings, and workflow improvements.

title: Explore muxile plugin for mobile tmux access
description:
Evaluate https://github.com/bjesus/muxile for potential Gas Town integration.

**What it does:**
- Mobile web access to tmux sessions via QR code/link
- Two-way control (view output + send commands)
- No app required - works in phone browser
- Uses WebSocket + Cloudflare Worker backend

**Potential uses:**
- Monitor long-running agents from phone
- Emergency intervention when away from desk
- Share sessions for debugging/pairing

**Dependencies:** qrencode, jq, websocat

**Evaluate:**
- Security implications of exposing sessions
- Self-hosted backend vs Cloudflare Worker
- Integration points with gt tmux commands

title: CRUD Engine (ecc-crud) - Artifact Persistence Layer
description:
Persistence layer and source of truth for Claude Code 2.1 artifacts. Mediates all traffic between Zgents and their artifact files.

**Principles:**
- Dumb CRUD: I/O + logging only, no business logic
- Observability first: Every operation logged with full context
- Phenomenal reliability: Bulletproof file operations

**Artifact Types:** Skill, Hook, SubAgent, Rule, Agent, Command, MCP Server

**Package:** ECC/ecc-crud/ (scaffolded)

**Plan:** /root/.claude/plans/crud-engine.md

title: Define operation types
description:
Create operation-types.ts with CrudOperation union: CreateOperation, ReadOperation, UpdateOperation, DeleteOperation, QueryOperation.

File: src/types/operation-types.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.1b, gt-crud.1c**

title: Define result types
description:
Create result-types.ts with OperationResult interface including success, operation, timestamp, durationMs, beforeState, afterState, error.

File: src/types/result-types.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.1a, gt-crud.1c**

title: Re-export artifact types from materializer
description:
Create artifact-types.ts that re-exports EccSkill, EccHook, EccSubAgent, EccRule, EccAgent, EccCommand, EccMcpServer from @ecc/materializer.

File: src/types/artifact-types.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.1a, gt-crud.1b**

title: Implement skill-handler.ts
description:
Skill-specific CRUD: parse/write SKILL.md with YAML frontmatter + markdown body. Handle hierarchical paths (.claude/skills/{category}/{name}/).

File: src/artifacts/skill-handler.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.2b through gt-crud.2g**

title: Implement hook-handler.ts
description:
Hook-specific CRUD: read/modify hooks array in settings.json. Aggregated pattern - must read whole file, modify section, write back.

File: src/artifacts/hook-handler.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.2a, gt-crud.2c through gt-crud.2g**

title: Implement subagent-handler.ts
description:
SubAgent-specific CRUD: parse/write markdown files with YAML frontmatter. One-to-one pattern at .claude/agents/{name}.md.

File: src/artifacts/subagent-handler.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.2a, gt-crud.2b, gt-crud.2d through gt-crud.2g**

title: Implement rule-handler.ts
description:
Rule-specific CRUD: simple markdown files at .claude/rules/{name}.md. One-to-one pattern, minimal frontmatter.

File: src/artifacts/rule-handler.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.2a through gt-crud.2c, gt-crud.2e through gt-crud.2g**

title: Implement agent-handler.ts
description:
Agent-specific CRUD: markdown with frontmatter at .claude/agents/{name}.md. Similar to subagent but top-level agent config.

File: src/artifacts/agent-handler.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.2a through gt-crud.2d, gt-crud.2f, gt-crud.2g**

title: Implement command-handler.ts
description:
Command-specific CRUD: markdown with frontmatter at .claude/commands/{name}.md. Slash command definitions.

File: src/artifacts/command-handler.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.2a through gt-crud.2e, gt-crud.2g**

title: Implement mcp-server-handler.ts
description:
MCP Server-specific CRUD: read/modify mcpServers section in settings.json. Aggregated pattern like hooks.

File: src/artifacts/mcp-server-handler.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.2a through gt-crud.2f**

title: Implement traffic-logger.ts
description:
Traffic logging decorator that wraps all CRUD operations. Logs start, success/error, duration, before/after state. Uses @ecc/orchestrator Logger.

File: src/logging/traffic-logger.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.3b, gt-crud.3c**

title: Implement snapshot.ts (versioning)
description:
Before/after state capture for mutating operations. ArtifactSnapshot interface with timestamp, state, filePath, fileHash.

File: src/versioning/snapshot.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.3a, gt-crud.3c**

title: Implement history.ts (operation history)
description:
Rolling operation history buffer. OperationHistory class with add(), getRecent(), findByArtifact(). Configurable maxEntries.

File: src/versioning/history.ts

**PARALLEL with gt-crud.3a, gt-crud.3b**

title: Implement CrudEngine class
description:
Main engine class that composes handlers, logging, versioning. Implements ArtifactQueryService interface for Explorer. createCrudEngine() factory with dev/prod modes.

File: src/core/crud-engine.ts

**Depends on all handlers and logging**

title: Write CRUD Engine tests
description:
Test suites for all handlers and core engine. Target >90% coverage. Test files: crud-engine.test.ts, artifact-handlers.test.ts, versioning.test.ts, traffic-logging.test.ts.

**Depends on CrudEngine completion**

title: Explorer-CrudEngine directory alignment
description:
When generateConfig() is called with a CrudEngine, the artifacts are written to two different directories:

1. **generateConfig creates**: /tmp/explorer-{id}-{uuid1}/.claude/
2. **CrudEngine writes to**: Its projectRoot/.claude/ (passed separately)

This causes artifacts created via CrudEngine to be in a different location than where generateConfig expects them.

**Options:**
1. Have generateConfig accept a pre-made configDir instead of creating its own
2. Have generateConfig create the CrudEngine internally after determining configDir
3. Add a setProjectRoot() method to CrudEngine for late binding

**Demo:** ECC/ecc-orchestrator/demo-crud-integration.ts shows the issue

title: Rename /root/gt to /root/gtOps
description:
Housekeeping: Rename the GasTownOperations repo folder from /root/gt to /root/gtOps for clarity.

Tasks:
- Rename the directory
- Update all path references in code and documentation
- Update any scripts that reference the old path
- Verify nothing breaks after rename

title: Fix gh-archive.sh error handling - PRs returning 0
description:
Fixed gh-archive.sh error handling:

**Root Cause:** GitHub API returns `comments` as an array of objects, not a count. The jq scoring functions were comparing arrays to numbers, causing silent failures.

**Fixes Applied:**
1. Changed `.comments // 0` to `(.comments // []) | length` in all scoring functions
2. Added `set -o pipefail` to catch pipeline errors
3. Added validation for 0 results with warnings
4. Added proper error handling in cmd_full() with temp files and rollback

**Verified:** PR fetch now returns 10+ items with correct significance scoring.
close_reason: Fixed and verified. Archive now syncs correctly: 245 issues, 571 PRs, 24 discussions.

title: tmuxMOO - MOO-inspired Operations Center
description:
Exploration and prototype of MOO-inspired tmux-based Operations Center where humans and Zgents collaborate in shared text environments.

**Vision:** tmux as the modern realization of MOO transport. Rooms = panes. Shared presence. Agents read each other via capture-pane. Persistence without presence.

**Key Decisions (from Steve):**
- Strades will eventually be a Zgent
- Blend MOO with Gas Town patterns
- Fork tmux config, develop personalized keyboard vocabulary
- Each Zgent gets a room, can talk across rooms
- Presentations are standard Zgent artifacts

**Open Questions (from BRIEFING.md):**
- 5.1: Agent-to-pane binding (leaning: room per Zgent, cross-room talk)
- 5.2: Command parsing in human pane
- 5.3: Inter-agent communication (Gas Town patterns)
- 5.5: Session topology
- 5.6: Integration with existing architecture
- 5.7: Persistence and replay

**Location:** gtOps/tmuxMOO/
**Reference:** BRIEFING.md

title: Create tmuxMOO demo scaffold
description:
Build the proof-of-concept demo described in BRIEFING.md Section 4.

**Structure:**
```
tmuxMOO/demo/
â”œâ”€â”€ .tmux.conf          # Modern theme, personalized prefix
â”œâ”€â”€ moo-demo.sh         # Launcher
â”œâ”€â”€ narrator.sh         # Simulated agent narrative
â””â”€â”€ README.md           # Setup + controls
```

**Features:**
- 3+ panes demonstrating agent output
- Human command pane
- Mouse support, keyboard navigation
- Detach/reattach persistence

title: Personalized tmux config
description:
Fork tmux configuration with Steve's preferences. Develop keyboard vocabulary through usage.

**Starting points:**
- Modern theme (not GameBoy)
- Prefix key selection (Ctrl+Space suggested in briefing)
- Mouse support enabled
- Alt+Arrow pane navigation
- Sensible defaults for split/resize

**Goal:** Config that feels natural, not like fighting the tool

title: Command parser prototype
description:
Prototype for parsing human commands in the command pane.

**From BRIEFING.md 5.2:**
- `/scan butterfly 5835 Â±5`
- `/ask deacon what's the volume profile?`

**Options to evaluate:**
1. Shell script with pattern matching
2. Node.js/Python REPL
3. LLM-backed natural language router

**Start simple:** Shell script that routes /commands to appropriate handlers

title: Session topology design
description:
Design session/pane topology for MOO operations.

**Constraints (from BRIEFING.md):**
- <10 instruments
- <36 users
- Room per Zgent, cross-room communication

**Questions:**
- One session per instrument? Per user? Per user-instrument?
- How do multiple humans share a narrative?
- How do Zgents claim/release panes?

**Deliverable:** Topology diagram and rationale doc

title: Zgent presentation standard
description:
Define presentations/ as a standard artifact directory for all Zgents.

**Template:** presentations/crudengine-exec-walkthrough/ (gt-pres1)

**Convention:**
- Each Zgent domain includes presentations/
- reveal.js format for browser viewing
- Executive-appropriate content
- Speaker notes for detailed context

**Deliverable:** Update Zgent spec to include presentation requirements

title: HTML Session Viewer for Explorer
description:
## Overview
Build an HTML viewer for Explorer sessions that renders structured event logs with visual differentiation between user input and Claude output.

## Approach
Option 2 from analysis: Structured Event Stream â†’ HTML Viewer

Leverages existing infrastructure:
- Observer hooks already capture tool calls
- ZgentTransport writes structured JSONL
- Build HTML viewer that reads JSONL and renders with CSS

## Key Components
1. **Extended hooks** - Capture `preUserMessage` and `postAssistantMessage` events
2. **Session event schema** - Define event types for user input, Claude response, tool calls
3. **HTML viewer** - Static page that reads JSONL and renders formatted output
4. **CSS differentiation** - User entries (blue), Claude responses (gray), tool calls (monospace/bordered)

## Mockup
```
â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
â”‚ ğŸ‘¤ User: run the tests                  â”‚  <- blue background
â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
â”‚ ğŸ¤– Claude: Running bun test...          â”‚  <- gray background
â”‚    âœ“ 229 tests passing                  â”‚
â”‚    [Bash] bun test                      â”‚  <- monospace, bordered
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
```

## Benefits
- Semantic structure from JSONL (not terminal parsing)
- Searchable, filterable
- Works with existing Zgent logging infrastructure
- No daemon overhead - file watching for real-time

## Dependencies
- gt-0pg (Centralized Zgent Logging) - DONE

title: CrudEngine Executive Presentation
description:
Create reveal.js HTML presentation delivering a detailed walkthrough of CrudEngine work for executive manager audience.

**Deliverable:** Self-contained HTML presentation (10-12 slides)

**Narrative Arc:**
1. Zgent Factory vision
2. Scale challenge (20-30 agents need infrastructure)
3. Pain points before CrudEngine
4. CrudEngine introduction
5. Architecture overview (Mermaid diagrams)
6. 7 artifact types
7. Built-in observability
8. Explorer integration
9. Demo highlight (traffic logging)
10. Business value
11. Strategic position
12. Status & next steps

**Output:** presentations/crudengine-exec-walkthrough/index.html

**Plan:** /root/.claude/plans/ancient-spinning-starfish.md

title: Refinement Sprint - Polish & Perspective
description:
Parallel presentation sprint: 4 agents each synthesize one facet of the Gas Town ecosystem into a reveal.js walkthrough. Combined output forms a 'convergence perspective' that guides deeper refinements.

Presentations (not code):
- gt-ref.1: Zgent Anatomy
- gt-ref.2: Rooms & Presence
- gt-ref.3: Infrastructure Stack
- gt-ref.4: Convergence Map (meta-synthesis)

Philosophy: refinement as discovery. The act of synthesizing surfaces connections that raw implementation misses.

title: Presentation: Anatomy of a Zgent
description:
Reveal.js presentation synthesizing what a Zgent IS across all domains: artifacts (ECC), lifecycle (CrudEngine), runtime (AOE), habitat (tmuxMOO), lineage (MOO VEE).

Key insight: A Zgent is a complete organism â€” structure, metabolism, senses, voice, habitat. The MOO parallel is real: programmable objects with verbs, living in persistent rooms.

Output: presentations/zgent-anatomy/index.html + README.md

title: Presentation: Rooms & Presence
description:
Reveal.js presentation telling the interaction model story: MOO â†’ tmux evolution, shared presence, panes as rooms, persistence without presence, session topology.

Key insight: MOO wasn't wrong â€” it was early. Text-first persistent rooms with programmable inhabitants IS the right model. tmux is the transport MOO needed. LLMs are the intelligence MOO's objects lacked.

Output: presentations/rooms-and-presence/index.html + README.md

title: Presentation: The Infrastructure Stack
description:
Reveal.js presentation showing how ECC, AOE, CrudEngine, and Explorer compose into a coherent stack. The plumbing story for technical-executive audience.

Key insight: The stack is designed around one principle â€” observability at every layer. ECC makes artifacts visible as data. AOE makes behavior visible as logs. CrudEngine makes mutations visible as traffic. Each layer adds a different kind of visibility.

Output: presentations/infrastructure-stack/index.html + README.md

title: Presentation: The Convergence Map
description:
Meta-synthesis presentation â€” the keystone. Looks across all domains and surfaces non-obvious connections:

1. Traffic Logging = Narrative Replay
2. Presentations as API Documentation
3. Rooms = Scoped Logging Contexts (all the way down)
4. Observability IS the Product
5. COO as World Builder
6. Scene = Room = Context (convergence)
7. Academy = Test Suite

Key insight: Three seemingly separate projects (infrastructure, interaction, ecosystem) are one system expressing itself at three levels of abstraction.

Output: presentations/convergence-map/index.html + README.md

title: Claude Code Explorer Engine Prototype
description:
Build the hybrid execution engine for the Claude Code Explorer sandbox. Uses hook injection for observability while running real Claude Code CLI.

**Architecture:** MCP Bridge + CLI Fallback
- Observer hooks capture all tool calls
- Event stream (SSE) to UI
- Scene templates from eccx data
- Config generator for .claude/ folders

**Reference:** ECC/claude-code-explorer-plan.md

title: Create observer.sh hook script
description:
Shell script that intercepts hook events, logs to event stream, and passes through to actual scene hooks.

Receives stdin from Claude Code, extracts tool call info, writes to event log, returns original hook exit code.

title: Create scene-loader.ts
description: TypeScript module to load scene YAML templates from eccx data files. Parses execution steps, parameters, commentary layers, prerequisites.

title: Create config-generator.ts
description: Generate temporary .claude/ folder structure for each scene. Injects observer hooks into settings.json, creates skills/agents from scene template.

title: Create executor.ts
description: Run Claude Code CLI with generated config, capture output, handle async streaming. Manages sandbox temp directories.

title: Create event-stream.ts
description: SSE/WebSocket server for streaming execution events to UI. Event types: tool_call_start, tool_call_end, hook_fired, response_chunk.

title: Create sample Scene 1.1 (Basic Skill)
description: First test scene: Basic Skill Creation. Minimal SKILL.md, load into session, invoke via /skill-name. Validates full pipeline.

title: Verify prototype end-to-end
description: Run Scene 1.1 through full pipeline: load template â†’ generate config â†’ execute Claude Code â†’ capture events â†’ stream to console. Document any gaps.

title: Agent Orchestration Engine (AOE) Foundation
description:
Reusable engine for managing Claude Code entities (skills, hooks, sub-agents). Serves Explorer sandbox, DReader agents, ParseClipmate, and future projects.

**Key Insight:** The engine is the product; Explorer is a reference implementation.

**Scope:** Logging subsystem, error handling hierarchy, event system.

**Package:** ECC/ecc-orchestrator (separate from ecc-materializer)

**Reference:** /root/.claude/plans/steady-spinning-twilight.md

title: Initialize ecc-orchestrator package
description:
Create package scaffolding: package.json (bun), tsconfig.json (strict, ES2022), directory structure per plan.

Dirs: src/logging/, src/errors/, src/events/, tests/

title: Event emitter implementation
description:
Type-safe pub/sub with EngineEventEmitter interface. on/off/once/emit methods. Max listener protection.

File: src/events/event-emitter.ts

title: Event type definitions
description:
EngineEventType union, EventDataMap interface for type-safe event payloads. Events: engine:*, hook:*, tool:*, scene:*, log:entry.

File: src/events/event-types.ts

title: Integration tests
description:
Test suites for logging (all transports), errors (creation, serialization), events (emit, subscribe). Target >90% coverage.

Files: tests/logging.test.ts, tests/errors.test.ts, tests/events.test.ts

title: Verify AOE foundation build
description:
Run bun build, verify TypeScript compiles, run tests, export public API from index.ts. Smoke test consumer import.

Success: Package builds, tests pass, can be imported.

title: Logger interface & factory
description:
Create Logger interface with debug/info/warn/error methods, child() for scoped loggers, event() for structured events. Factory function createLogger(config).

Files: src/logging/logger.ts, src/logging/types.ts

title: ConsoleTransport implementation
description:
stdout/stderr transport with ANSI color support. Respects NO_COLOR env var. Level-based coloring (debug=gray, info=white, warn=yellow, error=red).

File: src/logging/transports/console.ts

title: FileTransport implementation
description:
Append to log file with optional rotation. Uses native fs (no external deps). Rotation by size or date.

File: src/logging/transports/file.ts

title: EventTransport implementation
description:
Emit log entries as engine events for UI streaming. Bridges logging to event system.

File: src/logging/transports/event.ts

title: JsonFormatter implementation
description:
Structured JSON output for production/machine parsing. ISO timestamps, context flattening, error serialization.

File: src/logging/formatters/json.ts

title: PrettyFormatter implementation
description:
Colorized human-readable output for development. Timestamps, level badges, indented context.

File: src/logging/formatters/pretty.ts

title: Error type hierarchy
description:
Base OrchestrationError + categories: ConfigurationError (EntityNotFound, InvalidConfig, CircularDependency), RuntimeError (HookExecution, Timeout, ToolBlocked), IntegrationError (Beads, Mail, Tmux), SceneError (Prerequisite, Take).

File: src/errors/error-types.ts

title: Error handler utilities
description:
Error wrapping, context enrichment, stack formatting, toJSON() serialization.

File: src/errors/error-handler.ts

title: Zgent Factory - Interoperable Agent Ecosystem
description:
Long-lived epic for building the Zgent ecosystem: standalone Claude Code agents that share conventions enabling inter-agent interaction.

**Core Concept:**
- Zgents are agents processed through Gas Town Academy
- Each Zgent publishes its API so others can query it
- Shared conventions: logging, errors, events, config patterns
- COO is the hub for creating and enforcing these conventions

**Reference Implementation:**
- DReader: Discord collector, on path to well-formed Zgent
- Explorer Engine: Demonstrates AOE patterns

**Development Workflow (repeat for each capability):**
1. Implement with testing and logging
2. Review and confirm against spec
3. Create runnable demo
4. Conduct walkthrough verification
5. Document patterns for reuse

**Key Deliverables:**
- Zgent specification/contract
- API publication conventions
- Inter-agent query protocol
- Academy graduation criteria

title: Design GT workflow experiment based on Discord mental model post
description:
A Discord user described expected GT workflow:

EXPECTED:
1. Create spec/plan with crew member
2. Ask crew to create beads (epics/tasks) from plan
3. Sling epic to rig's polecats
4. Mayor creates convoy of waves with gates watching merge queue
5. Refinery merge â†’ message to gate â†’ auto-close gate â†’ release next wave

ACTUAL PROBLEM:
- Wave 2 kicks off before Wave 1 merges
- Polecats sync from main (missing dependent work)
- Everything falls off the rails

ACTION: Design a controlled experiment to test this workflow and document actual GT behavior. Use findings to inform COO operational strategy.
